answers.answer: Hi!I am sorry that you have stage 4 liver fibrosis! This means you have cirrhosis with less than 50% of biopsied tissue fibrotic. In the next stage, more than 50% of biopsied tissue will be fibrotic with aggravation of symptoms. So, yes, its good that you are reaching out o stabilize your condition.Fibrosis is usually reversible in early stages, stage 0 and 1. Thereafter, though animal models have shown that fibrosis is reversible, no human study has been able to demonstrate that as repeated invasive studies are not possible. So, let’s assume that if you really care for your liver now, then progression of fibrosis can be slowed down or halted.The best way to do so is to reverse the cause of cirrhosis—alcohol, drugs, deficiency disorders, hepatitis, glycogen storage disease etc. Effects of causes like alcohol and drugs can be reversed by stopping these and managing your diet. However, other causes can me managed by managing the condition. If cause is hepatitis, you will need anti-viral therapy along with proper diet.If the cause is any storage disease, metabolic disease such as diabetes or a deficiency disease such as alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency, then this can be managed by eating the right diet and remaining active.Since swelling is there is feet and stomach, you also have ascites. A cardiac angle should also be explored. Anti-fibrotic therapy can be started. Diuretics like aldoseterone derivatives or loop diuretics are used to reduce ascites. Paracentesis is tried for large ascites.Apart from this you need to stop fat and alcohol intake and eat simple meals. Exact medications cannot be prescribed without examining you. So, please consult your docor regarding this. Take care!I sincerely hope you will find this information useful in your journey towards better health.Hope you get well soon! Good Luck and take care!
